findings.title: The code uses eval() or exec() which allows arbitrary code execution
findings.explanation: The code uses eval() or exec() which allows arbitrary code execution. This is a major security risk that can be exploited to run malicious code.
findings.fix: // Remove eval() and use safer alternatives like JSON.parse()

findings.snippet: const fn = new Function('return ' + code);  // ⚠️ DANGEROUS

findings.title: Errors are caught but not handled, causing silent failures
findings.explanation: Errors are caught but not handled, causing silent failures. This makes debugging extremely difficult and can lead to data corruption going unnoticed.

findings.title: Numeric literals are used directly without named constants, making the code hard to understand and maintain
findings.explanation: Numeric literals are used directly without named constants, making the code hard to understand and maintain. Changes require hunting for all instances.
findings.fix:
const MAX_RETRIES = 3;
// Use the constant instead of literal
